text: A conductor has been given a charge – 3 × <math><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>-7</mn></msup></math>C by transferring electron. Increase in mass (in kg) of the conductor and the number of electrons added to the conductor are respectively
hint: Here, q = -3 × <math><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>-7</mn></msup></math>C Number of electrons transferred to the conductor is  <math display="block"> <mrow>n=<mfrac><mrow>q</mrow><mrow>e</mrow></mfrac>=<mfrac><mrow>-3×1<msup><mrow>0</mrow><mrow>-7</mrow></msup>C</mrow><mrow>-1.6×1<msup><mrow>0</mrow><mrow>-19</mrow></msup>C</mrow></mfrac><mo>≈</mo>2×1<msup><mrow>0</mrow><mrow>12</mrow></msup></mrow> </math> Mass of one electron, <math><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>e</mn></msub></math> = 9.1 × <math><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>-31</mn></msup></math> kg Increase mass of the conductor = <math><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>e</mn></msub></math>×n = 9.1 × <math><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>-31 </mn></msup></math>× 2 × <math><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>12</mn></msup></math> = 18.2 × <math><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>-19 </mn></msup></math>kg ≈ 2 × <math><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>-18</mn></msup></math>kg
